This is the first sublesson of the first part.

Here is a preview of what you might see in a sublesson.

Code samples will show up like this:

const example = `You can embed source code in a lot of languages!`

Interactive Browser Examples

One of the coolest parts is that we can use interactive browser examples like this one.

Try changing the "reader" in name="reader" with your name!

const Greetings = ({ name }) => {
  return (
    <>
      <p>Hey {name}!</p>
      <p>Did anyone ever tell you how awesome you are?</p>
    </>
  )
}
render(() => <Greetings name="reader" />)
Result
Hey reader!
Did anyone ever tell you how awesome you are?

Practice

Other examples of hands-on practice include:

  • exercises
  • quizzes
  • reflection questions

These will be verifiable using the CLI. We'll also help you track your progress throughout the course.

More details coming soon!

Share demo

Thanks for stopping by to check out the demo! If you enjoyed it, it would mean a lot if you could share it on Twitter.
